results.title: How will we know it's us?
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ravitz, Lawrence Ravitz Associates and National Trust for Historic Preservation
results.brief_description: Explores the importance of preserving and restoring historic buildings, explaining that continuity and change need not fight each other. We see projects in five communities throughout America in which preservation has been an essential element in urban renewal programs.

results.title: How we get our power
results.brief_description: Explains how power comes from nature and how humans have learned to put this power to use. Surveys the major sources of power: wind, water, fuel, explosives and the atom.

results.title: How vacuum tubes work
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Leonard Bender and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Explains the structure of a diode and a triode and how they work as a rectifier and amplifier. Illustrates clearly why the hot filament and cold plate will permit the plate current to flow in one direction only and this functions as a half-wave rectifier.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Robinson, Leonard Bender and McGraw-Hill Films

results.brief_description: Trees help us by supplying timber, food, and material we make. Shows how long it takes a tree to grow, and how it is valuable throughout its life.

results.title: How to work with your fellow managers
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Peter Drucker hosts this film which shows how friction, lack of understanding and poor teamwork among managers is largely a matter of poor relationships, rather than poor communication. Managers do not try to understand the different objectives of each section.

results.title: How to use the telephone
results.creator_credit: Michael Law, H M Treasury and Public Relations Films
results.brief_description: A training film made for use in Government (British) departments pointing out common mistakes in using the telephone and showing how a proper understanding of the relationship between caller, switchboard and extension-user can save a great deal of valuable time and energy.

results.title: How to take the right risks: the manager as decision maker
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, Ameron and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
All decisions involve an element of risk. The issues must be carefully defined and all alternatives considered. Also if it is not an isolated incident, it is desirable to establish a policy for dealing with similar situations. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Pare Lorentz Jr, Ameron and BNA Communications

results.title: How to supervise
results.creator_credit: David Pitt, Francis Gysin and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: Defines the responsibilities of the supervisor and reinforces the need for a civilised relationship between supervisor and trainee, by giving hints for supervisors on how they should attend to the training and safety of young entrants under their charge. Although made for the coal industry most of the ideas are generally applicable.

results.description: Defines the responsibilities of the supervisor and reinforces the need for a civilised relationship between supervisor and trainee, by giving hints for supervisors on how they should attend to the training and safety of young entrants under their charge.
